passage_and_questions.passage: A mirror is something we all have at home, but have you ever thought about the lessons it can teach us? When you look in a mirror, it shows you your reflection exactly as it is, which helps you see yourself clearly. If you smile, the mirror smiles back, but if you frown, it does the same, showing how life often reflects our actions. This is just like how people behave towards us in real life: if we are kind and polite, they will usually respond with kindness, but if we are rude, they might act against us. A mirror doesn’t allow you to lie about how you look, reminding us that we should be honest about our actions and words. Actually, being honest and kind is one of the most important lessons in life, because it helps us build good relationships with others. In some situations, you need to be careful about how you behave, especially if you are providing a service to others, since your behavior can affect how people see you. For example, a good waiter is able to stay calm and polite, even if a customer is upset, which not only helps solve problems but also shows professionalism. Life, like a mirror, reflects what you give it, so if you take care of others, they will take care of you in return.

questions.question_name: What is the main idea of the passage?

answers.value: Life is like a mirror; it reflects how we behave towards others.
A mirror is an important tool in every home.
Good waiters must always be polite to customers.
Being rude will make people behave kindly towards you.

explanation.english: The passage compares life to a mirror, explaining how our actions and behavior are reflected back to us by others.
